description: Excellent tool for scholars and students of the Bible. Offers an entire Bible College library of works from sages down through the ages. Thank you for making this valuable resource available to the "Linux world".

description:
I'm rating 5 because 1) I am sorry people need to be so 
belligerant about something, but if a person is old enough
to type in full sentences, they should also be old enough to r
understand that the fact they are faithless cretins does not extend to
to all people. There are extremely intelligent people who use the 
Bible as a text book, therefore it most certainly belongs EXACTLY 
where it is. YOU can scroll right on by, it didn't hunt you down, now 
did it?

This is my least favorite work of fiction. There are far more interesting storybooks out there guys. Not much worth learning in it as it is all unbased, scientifically and mathematically inaccurate, and mostly outdated anecdotes. Seriously, this one will bore you and make you feel sorry for the authors and fans. I recommend Marvel or Percy Jackson. The god in this book is a loser and not as cool as Zeuss or Athena.

Please take my advice, the people that give 1 star reviews do not know what they talk about.
1st, This app belongs to the category where it is located, that's right, this is a Science and Learning app people!. 
2nd, It needs improvements on its UI, which is very basic and not pretty by modern standards, but it works great, it is lightweight, performs fast, it has a wide variety of translations and commentaries that make studying more accessible. 
3rd, Yes, IT IS FREE! 
4th, It would be better if it would come with some basic modules already installed, with the option to add more later on. but you have to choose a set of sources to import content from out of the box, and that's all right too.

Again, some people want this app removed out of hate because they do not clearly understand the content of it. To all of you out there, please read Romans chapter 1, really, just read it. Linux is open source and the developer(s) have put hard work, sacrifice and dedication into this project, all for free.
summary: The app is an excellent tool, the bad reviews are biased though

description: Hate the bible, but I can respect the idea that the devs are trying to make another Terry Davis. (I really hope it's programmed in Holy C...)

This app is so nice. I was really excited when I found I could download Wycliffe's and Tyndale's Bibles. My challenge is, not all of Tydale's Bible is available. According to the internet, Tyndale had translated all the New Testament, the books of Moses, and most of the books of the history of the Jews in the Old Testament. I cannot access these. 
Otherwise, the app is great, and I would definitely recommend it.
summary: Great app, would recommend, but has some issues

description:
Its a good app and in KDE exports its menu to the global menu system which is a nice touch indeed. The app is easy to use but does need to be updated to look modern by todays app standards

A small note - people giving this a one star are God haters. They actually have spent time to install then spew there nonsense which shows they are terrified by the fact that they know that one day they will stand before God in judgement at that day to account for their lives

Incredibly disappointed in the plebians that have taken to infesting the reviews with their snarky psuedo-intellectual non-comments. But, on to the actual review: I really like the GUI of this app, it's really comfortable to use and I believe it is slightly superior to Xiphos.
This applications allows you to read the Bible. It wasn't too hard to download Bible versions either. Five stars!

- The ability to choose different translations is awesome. (Even my native language is supported!)
- You can also display translations side by side which is very helpful
- Lexicons automatically displays the definitions at the left so it's awesome.
- Search and many more ...
summary: Great app that offers different translations and lexicons

Good Job! -Peter
summary: Its good to do Gods will on Linux!

description: ...is a fool and should be avoided. I am paraphrasing an old Arabian proverb that is not from the Bible. So then, why put it there? Because while I am a Christian, and a student of the Bible, I would myself be a fool to claim that there is no need of any instruction that is not specifically in the Bible. Yeah, it is a great book to live by and you can learn a ton from it. But not everything. Not even close. Indeed, I can type about 85 wpm and never found this in the Bible.  But for those who spout about the Bible being fiction yet call people in the Bible baby-killers and slave-owners. If it's fiction, what is the problem? It never happened. Are those things a good idea? NO! But not everyone in the Bible is lumped into one group; no good no evil just that group. And yet I am the fool? Also, please stop SAYING that there are errors and contradictions! I have carried a Bible around and read it in my own time and not in everyone's plain sight. But people walking by (as one type of example) will come at me all angry and had people start saying these things and every single time when I ask, "Please, show me. I did not know that and I would certainly like to know." Nobody can, and nobody will find errors. Okay, Think: over more than 20 centuries, there have been very many minds sharper that yours or mine who have combed through this Bible trying to find something--ANYthing!--don't you think that it would have hit NATIONAL news, headlines, etc.? Somebody finally found one! No. You would think that in a span of time close to 4,000 years, 66 "Books" (scrolls, codices and eventually books) but okay 66 Books, and by at least 35 some think closer to 40 but either way, 35-40 different authors. And there is not one discrepancy? I will be the first to admit: such odds are outright impossible...if not for God's Divine inspiration But really: would you want a god who you could completely figure out as in nothing a mystery or wonder. NO! Think for yourselves; find your own answers! Think: Non-life cannot become life. Ever. The probability according to Dr. Bradley and Dr. Thaxton calculated the probability of amino acids "Naturally" forming into a protein as 4.9 x 10^-191 chance. Since anything below a number to the negative 50th power is essentially Zero, I would say, think for yourself. Go to genesisapologetics.com or icr.org to check it out for yourself. I think you will learn a lot whether you ever become a Christian. They are not mutually exclusive. The universe could not always have been because all the stars would be burned out since nobody has ever witnessed a star being born. The closest possible is a wolf rayett (sp?) brown dwarf...and even then, no. But nebulae are explosion remnants. Gases like to naturally disperse, not glue together. And for something to have created itself it would have to both exist to create it and not exist to be created! Think, my friends! The evidence is literally everywhere and it is so cool!!
summary: Someone who is without knowledge but does not know this...

description: The sheer amount of content available is impressive. Thank you to all the devs and those who have made the content available.
summary: This is a great tool, thank you!
